H0.text: Who was the legless World War II fighter pilot who was detained in German prisoner of war camps for 4 years. Colin Pinckney

H1.text: Who was the legless World War II fighter pilot who was detained in German prisoner of war camps for 4 years. William Simpson

H2.text: Who was the legless World War II fighter pilot who was detained in German prisoner of war camps for 4 years. Geoffrey Quill

H3.text: Who was the legless World War II fighter pilot who was detained in German prisoner of war camps for 4 years. Douglas Bader

A4.text: In August 1941, Bader bailed out over German-occupied France and was captured.

A5.text: He remained there until April 1945 when the camp was liberated by the First United States Army.
